title.narrative: QUALITY MCH SERVICES

description.narrative: System strengthening to deliver essential quality health services for mothers and young children:Availability of and access to essential quality evidence based interventions, skilled human resources and delivery systems for mothers' and children's health care ensured through innovative demonstration models and scale up plans., which contributes to Child Health, Child Health (Covid), Early Childhood Development, Health Systems Strengthening, Immunization, Maternal And Newborn Health, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By end-2020, all children, including children with developmental difficulties, have access to quality health services to ensure child survival, health and better developmental outcomes.

MINISTRY OF HEALTH AND MEDICAL INDUSTRY OF TURKMENISTAN
SCIENTIFIC AND CLINICAL CENTER OF MOTHER AND CHILD HEALTH

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: System strengthening to deliver essential quality health services for mothers and young children:Availability of and access toessential quality evidence based interventions, skilled human resources and delivery systems for mothers? and children?s healthcare ensured through innovative demonstration models and scale up plans.

description.narrative: The reduction of childhood mortality and improvement of the quality of maternal, newborn, and child health (MNCH) care remains a key priority for the Ministry of Health and Medical Industry. In this regard, Turkmenistan ;continued implementation of the 4th year of the ‘Every New-born Action Plan’ (ENAP) through introduction of quality assurance tools and standards, developed with UNICEF support in 2019. UNICEF and national partner continued capacity building in ECD, IPC, Risk Communication, Nutrition and vaccine procurement using distance learning and online mentoring. Turkmenistan put major efforts to maintain continuity of essential health services during the outbreak of the pandemic. | Status:Met | As-of Date:26/01/2021
